Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should legalize sex selection", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Sex selection will increase abortions<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection will create abortions/infanticide
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that sex selection will increase abortions

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Pre-selecting your baby's sex is a form of gender discrimination.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection reaffirms gender stereotypes/biases
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that pre-selecting your baby's sex is a form of gender discrimination.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Sex selection will have troublesome effects on gender disparity.<sep>Keypoint: It is unethical/unhealthy for parents to intervene
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that sex selection will have troublesome effects on gender disparity.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Absolutely supporting legalizing sex selection as some parents not able to have male or female kids so having a choice to choose the gender of next kid is absolutely amazing.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that absolutely supporting legalizing sex selection as some parents not able to have male or female kids so having a choice to choose the gender of next kid is absolutely amazing.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Sex selection should not be legalized as it isnt ethical its going against the natural course of life<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection can lead to gender imbalance
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that sex selection should not be legalized as it isnt ethical its going against the natural course of life

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Sex selection should be legalized because it gives couples the options to plan a family<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that sex selection should be legalized because it gives couples the options to plan a family

Argument: Selecting the sex of babies could lead to an in balance in society demonstrated by china , where the one child policy resulted in areas where there are approximately 10 males to 1 female.<sep>Keypoint: It is unethical/unhealthy for parents to intervene

Argument: Sex selection can lead to a gender imbalance if one sex is favoured over the other. this can lead to a lack of suitable partners in the future and people being forced to lead a single life.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection can lead to gender imbalance
Argument: The selection of sex can break the natural balance between males and females<sep>Keypoint: It is unethical/unhealthy for parents to intervene
Argument: Parents have the right to select the sex of their child<sep>Keypoint: It is within the freedoms of the parents to select the sex of the child
Argument: It should not be legal, it is costly and morally wrong<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection is expensive

Argument: Its unnatural. you shouldn't have the right or ability to choose or abort based solely on sex. this can lead to complete disproportionate numbers if people decide to favor one sex over the other.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection reaffirms gender stereotypes/biases
Argument: Sex selection will leave some countries with more males than females because certain countries value males more than females<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection can lead to gender imbalance

Argument: If a family has a child or multiple children of the same sex, sex selection allows for the family to insure they have a child of the opposite sex.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection prevents diseases in the child

Argument: We should not legalize sex selection as this is enabling people to play god and may lead to the destabilisation of future generations e.g. more males than females<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection can lead to gender imbalance
Argument: This should be banned as it is immoral.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection can lead to gender imbalance
Argument: It's a personal decision that should not be regulated<sep>Keypoint: It is within the freedoms of the parents to select the sex of the child
Argument: Sex selection enhances people's right to choose and should be legalized.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning

Argument: Sex selection is unethical, it shouldn't matter if the baby is born a boy or a girl, as long as the baby is healthy that's all what matters. parents shouldn't be acting like god<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection can lead to gender imbalance

Argument: We should legalize sex selection because people should be able to pick the sex of the baby they want instead of having the sex forced on them<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning

Argument: Sex selection should be legalised for parents who wish to choose the sex of their child. it is no one else's business but their own.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning
Argument: The right to bodily autonomy permits mothers to have abortions for sex selective purposes<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning

Argument: Sex selection allows families to be balanced.<sep>Keypoint: Sex selection allows for better family planning
